teams.description: Contains teams belonging to an API.

APIResponsesModel.description: This model contains the basics details of all APIs.

accessKey.description: The access key ID for the AWS instance. This is used to sign the requests

region.description: The configured AWS instance region detail

secretKey.description: The secret access key for the AWS instance. This is used to sign the requests

AccessProfile.description: This model contains details about a Team in API Gateway

description.description: description of the accessprofile

groupIds.description: list of groupIds assigned to the accessprofile

id.description: AccessProfile ID

includeTeamAdminsAsApprovers.description: When the property is set to true, all the team administrators becomes approvers. The default value is false

appliesToUsers.description: List of users to whom the account locking settings apply. Possible values are 'allUsersExceptPredefinedUsers' and 'allUsers'. 'allUsersExceptPredefinedUsers' indicates that account locking rules apply to all user accounts except the predefined user accounts. 'allUsers' indicates the account locking rules apply to all user accounts.

blockDuration.description: Duration for which the account remains locked.

blockDurationUnit.description: The unit for the duration specified under 'blockDuration' field. Possible values are 'Minutes', 'Hours', 'Days'.

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable the account locking settings. Possible values are 'true' and 'false'

maximumLoginAttempts.description: Number of attempts in the specified time interval (specified using timeInterval and timeIntervalUnit fields) to provide the correct password before locking the account

restrictLoginForUsersInDefaultTeam.description: Specifies whether to restrict login for users who are not part of any team other than Default. By default the value is false.

timeInterval.description: The time interval within which the number of wrong login attempts exceeding the value specified in 'maximumLoginAttempts' will result in locking the account.

timeIntervalUnit.description: The unit for the time interval specified in the 'timeInterval' field. Possible values are 'Minutes', 'Hours', 'Days'.

description.description: A description about the alias

id.description: A unique ID for the alias

stage.description: Stage for which this alias needs to be used

httpsEnabled.description: Enable secure connection between API Gateway and Analytics Data Store.

keepAlive.description: To use persistent connection between APIGateway and Analytics Data Store.

keepAliveMaxConnections.description: Maximum number of persistent connections that can be maintained between API Gateway and cluster of Analytics Data Store.

keepAliveMaxConnectionsPerRoute.description: Maximum number of persistent connections that can be maintained between API Gateway and single Analytics Data Store for single HTTP route.

keystoreAlias.description: Alias name of the certificate that needs to be used from keystore.

maxRetryTimeout.description: Time out in milli seconds to wait for retries.

outboundProxyAlias.description: Outbound proxy alias name that is created in API Gateway.

truststoreName.description: Truststore location contains Analytics Data Store certificate details.

lastModified.description: last modified time of the application

ownerType.description: The application's owner type can be user or a team. By default, its the user who created the application.

ApprovalConfiguration.description: This model contains details about an ApprovalConfiguration in API Gateway

approvalMode.description: Only possible value is anyone. This implies that, any one user associated with the approvers team can approve or reject the requests. The requester need not wait for the approval of each approver in the approvers group.

approversGroupId.description: Approvers Accessprofile Identifier. Whoever belongs to the selected team will be considered as Approvers

autoApproval.description: The created request will be auto-approved when the requester is a valid approver and the value is true. Default value is true.

id.description: Unique identifier of a Approval Configuration. Any of 'createApplication', 'updateApplication', 'registerApplication', 'subscribePackage' and 'changeOwner'

isEnabled.description: true/false. true value enforces approvals for the mentioned eventtype

teamApprovers.description: The asset specific team approvers will be the approvers when the value is true. Default value is false.

approversGroupId.description: Approvers Accessprofile Identifier. Whoever belongs to the selected team will be considered as Approvers

mode.description: Mode of the request approval and 'anyone' is the only allowed value

requestorFirstName.description: First name of the requestor user name

requestorLastName.description: Last name of the requestor user name

apiId.description: The UUID of the API from which the tracer events are exported.

apiType.description: The type of the API. Possible values are SOAP, REST, ODATA

correlationIDs.description: Specifies the list of Correlation ID data for which trace information should be archived.

assertionId.description: A unique ID for the assertion

dependencyFailed.description: Specified whether the dependency asset is failed or not

overwritten.description: Specifies whether the promoted asset overwrite any existing asset or not

status.description: Status of the API gateway asset i.e success or failure

Attribute.description: An Attribute contains the field of the an API or resource or operation and the value to be processed on the fields based on the operation specified. If attribute specifies any Http Method then operation wont have any significance.

attributeName.description: The field name on which needs to be satisfied by the APIs.

operation.description: Operation that needs to performed on the field specified.

value.description: Value the needs to processed on the field and operation specified.

destination.description: Specifies whether the logger is to write entries to a file or database.

enable.description: Enable activation to enable the logger to start writing the log entries to the database or the file.

guaranteed.description: Provides data about guaranteed delivery transactions.

maximumQueueSize.description: Specifies the maximum number of entries the queue can hold.

maximumRetries.description: Specifies the maximum times the logger must retry writing the entry to the destination if the first attempt fails because of a transient error.

mode.description: Specifies whether the logger is to write entries to the destination synchronously or asynchronously.

name.description: The default name of the audit log, API Gateway Transaction Logger.

waitBetweenRetries.description: Specifies the waiting time before the logger can reconnect and rewrite the eateries to the destination in case of failure.

providerName.description: Name of the provider which was created using ClientMetadataMapping alias, used in the Dynamic client registration

scopes.description: List of scopes available in the authorization server

supportedGrantTypes.description: List of grant types supported by the authorization server

scopeName.description: OAuth scope name from authorization server definition

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use

get$ref.description: The available paths and operations for the API

in.description: The location of the parameter. Possible values are "query", "header", "path" or "cookie"

gatewayAssetId.description: Specifies the registered API Gateway ID.

uddiPort.description: Specifies the port on which CAST is listening. The default port number for CAST is 53307.

ClientRegistration.description: Shows the configurations set for the oauth client, when using Dynamic Client Registration. This is a read only model. To update the configuration use the DynamicClientRegistrationConfig model.

authCodeAllowed.description: Option to choose Authorization code grant type

clScopes.description: The scopes associated with this client

implicitAllowed.description: Option to choose Implicit grant type

pkceType.description: OAuth client level options to apply PKCE security, for the public clients using authorization code grant type. Applicable only for local auth server.

redirectUris.description: List of redirect urls allowed for this client

resourceOwnerAllowed.description: Option to choose Resource Owner grant type

tokenRefreshLimit.description: The number of times token can be refreshed

type.description: specifies whether the client is either public or confidential client

currentlyClustered.description: The current clustered state of APIGateway.

message.description: Message to be displayed to the clients.

pendingRestart.description: The property used to determine whether APIGateway is pending for restart for the cluster settings to take effect.

callbacks.description: An object to hold reusable callback objects

allOf.description: Must be valid against all of the subschemas

anyOf.description: Must be valid against any of the subschemas

oneOf.description: Must be valid against exactly one of the subschemas

email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization

name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization

url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information

allowEmptyValue.description: Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters. This is valid only for query parameters and allows sending a parameter with an empty value

allowReserved.description: Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as defined by RFC3986 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding. This property only applies to parameters with an in value of query. The default value is false

content.description: A map containing the representations for the parameter. The key is the media type and the value describes it. The map MUST only contain one entry

deprecated.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use

examples.description: Examples of the media type. Each example SHOULD contain a value in the correct format as specified in the parameter encoding. The examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the examples value SHALL override the example provided by the schema

explode.description: When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value is false

extendedExample.description: Example of the media type. The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if present. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the example value SHALL override the example provided by the schema. To represent examples of media types that cannot naturally be represented in JSON or YAML, a string value can contain the example with escaping where necessary

get$ref.description: The available paths and operations for the API

in.description: The location of the parameter. Possible values are "query", "header", "path" or "cookie"

name.description: The name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive

required.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false

style.description: Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value. Default values (based on value of in): for query - form; for path - simple; for header - simple; for cookie - form

correlationID.description: The correlation ID of the tracer event which should be archived.

creationDate.description: The epoch timestamp (in milliseconds) of the instance when the runtime execution happened.

status.description: The status of the runtime execution. Possible values are SUCCESS, FAILURE

statusCode.description: The status code of the runtime execution.

Cost.description: Cost details of a plan. It will be used for user information only and wont be enforced.

domain.description: Specify a domain to access the native API

password.description: Specify a base64 encoded password to access the native API

userName.description: Specify a username to access the native API

blockIntervalInSeconds.description: Specifies the block time interval(in seconds) for an IP address from accessing APIGateway

deniedIPList.description: Specifies list of IP addresses that are denied from accessing APIGateway

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable authentication based restrictions by blocking/denying IP addresses which failed authentication.

maximumFailedAuthRequests.description: Specifies maximum failed requests for a particular IP address.

maximumFailedAuthRequestsDuration.description: Specifies the time interval, in seconds, in which maximum authentication failure can be permitted.

whenLimitExceeds.description: Specifies action to be performed when maximum failed request is breached. The value can be BLOCK or DENY

Destination.description: This defines the configurations required for the destination.

metricsPublishInterval.description: The interval at which the metrics will be published to the destination. Enter a value from 1 through 60. The default is 60 minutes.

EmailConfiguration.description: This model contains details about an EmailConfiguration configured in Approvals of API Gateway

enabled.description: true/false. Email would be sent to user only when enabled value is true.

requestType.description: Request Type. Value would be any of initiated, approved or rejected.

EmailDestination.description: This defines the configurations required for Email destination.

defaultEmailCharset.description: The character set that API Gateway uses to be recognized by the system.

fromEmail.description: The email address from which you want to send the alerts.

logInvocationContent.description: The content of the email to be sent for the Log Invocation policy action.

password.description: The password that API Gateway uses to connect to the specified SMTP server.

port.description: The port that API Gateway uses to connect to the specified SMTP server.

smtpServer.description: The server name or the IP address of the SMTP server that API Gateway uses to send the messages.

Endpoints.description: This defines the service registry publish information for API Gateway's API endpoints

gatewayEndpoint.description: API's access endpoint exposed in API Gateway.

status.description: Status of the API endpoint. Shows whether this endpoint is published to the service registry.Possible values are NEW, PUBLISHED and SUSPENDED. NEW represents the endpoint is not published to the service registry. PUBLISHED represents the endpoint is published to the service registry. SUSPENDED represents the endpoint is published to service registry, but is not currently active (for example: during deactivation of API or shutdown of API Gateway or disabling ports).

Enforcement.description: Model contains a policy  enforcement id and its order

EnforcementValidationError.description: This model is used to represent the type of policy enforcement validation error

allowedOccurrence.description: This value will be populated when the error occurred due to occurrence of policy enforcement

conflictingTemplateId.description: This value will be populated when the error occurred due to mutually exclusive policy enforcement are available at the runtime enforcement of an API

errorType.description: The type of the policy enforcement validation error

missingDependency.description: The value of the list of missed policy enforcement which are dependent for this policy enforcement. This will be populated when the policy enforcement validation error occurred due to dependency missing

policyActionName.description: The name of the policy enforcement which is having the validation error

templateId.description: The template Id of the policy enforcement which is having the validation error

EnforcementValidationMessage.description:
This model is used to give the details about conflicts between the policy enforcements. The conflicts may arise due to dependent policy action enforcement missing or due to occurrence or due to mutually exclusive policy enforcements. These happen during the below scenarios 
1. When a policy is attached to an API, the enforcement validation will happen on policy.
2. When a global policy is getting activated, it will validate the policy enforcement of the corresponding global policy and the runtime policy enforcements on the applicable APIs for any violation.

apiId.description: ID of the API which is having the policy enforcement violation

apiName.description: Name of the API which is having the policy enforcement violation

apiType.description: Type of the API which is having the policy enforcement violation

apiVersion.description: Version of the API which is having the policy enforcement violation

ErrorProcessing.description: Defines the error message configuration. The configured error message will be sent to the invoking client in case API Gateway encounters an exception.

description.description: Long description for the example

externalValue.description: A URL that points to the literal example. This provides the capability to reference examples that cannot easily be included in JSON or YAML documents. The value field and externalValue field are mutually exclusive

value.description: Embedded literal example. The value field and externalValue field are mutually exclusive. To represent examples of media types that cannot naturally represented in JSON or YAML, use a string value to contain the example, escaping where necessary

ExportContext.description: This defines the request structure to export the specific assets across API Gateway

condition.description: Condition between scope specified. The value can be either 'and' or 'or'

deploymentFilter.description: This filter is used for deployment types.

from.description: The starting index of the record to be fetched. Default value is 0 which fetches from the start. The index is applied to each type separately. For each type the first n records are skipped as specified in from field. If the value specified is less than zero then the default value is taken for fetching records

responseFields.description: List of fields to be fetched for the specified types.

size.description: Number of records to be fetched. Default value is -1, which fetches all the records. The size is applied to each type separately. Each type has the records less than or equal to the size specified. If the value specified is less than zero then the default value is taken for fetching records

sortByField.description: Field name on which the sorting needs to be applied.

teamFilter.description: This filter is used to specify list teams to apply on the search results.

types.description: List of allowed types that can be searched across API Gateway.

endpointType.description: Type of endpoint for which the additional header needs to sent

description.description: A short description of the target documentation

url.description: The URL for the target documentation

ExternalPortal.description: This defines the API Portal configuration.

endpointPassword.description: Password for API Portal user used by API Gateway to access portal.

endpointUsername.description: API Portal username used by API Gateway to communicate.

allowEmptyValue.description: Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters. This is valid only for query parameters and allows sending a parameter with an empty value

allowReserved.description: Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as defined by RFC3986 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding. This property only applies to parameters with an in value of query. The default value is false

content.description: A map containing the representations for the parameter. The key is the media type and the value describes it. The map MUST only contain one entry

deprecated.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use

examples.description: Examples of the media type. Each example SHOULD contain a value in the correct format as specified in the parameter encoding. The examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the examples value SHALL override the example provided by the schema

explode.description: When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value is false

extendedExample.description: Example of the media type. The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if present. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the example value SHALL override the example provided by the schema. To represent examples of media types that cannot naturally be represented in JSON or YAML, a string value can contain the example with escaping where necessary

get$ref.description: The available paths and operations for the API

in.description: The location of the parameter. Possible values are "query", "header", "path" or "cookie"

name.description: The name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive

required.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false

style.description: Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value. Default values (based on value of in): for query - form; for path - simple; for header - simple; for cookie - form

autoScale.description: Specifies whether to auto scale caching dynamically

cacheSizeInPercent.description: Specifies the caching size in percentage

collectStatistics.description: Specifies whether to collect statistics for the caching

keyAlias.description:
The alias of the private key that is stored in the keystore specified by the keystore alias.
The Key alias field contains a list of the available aliases in the selected keystore. If there are no configured keystores, this field is empty

keystoreAlias.description: The Keystore alias field contains a list of the available keystore aliases in API Gateway. If there are no configured keystore aliases, this field lists the default Integration Server keystore, DEFAULT_IS_KEYSTORE .

rootFileName.description: Required when creating an API by importing protected URL

url.description: Required when creating an API by importing URL

This contains the publish information for multiple APIs. Required when publishing more than one API to one or more service registries.

unpublishInfos.description: This contains the unpublish information for multiple APIs. Required when publishing more than one API from one or more service registries.

folderName.description: Name of the folder under the package (mentioned on 'packageName' property) in which the API to be published. This field is required.

failureReason.description: Provides the reason for the failure when the publish operation is not successful

success.description: Represents whether the publish of API to the service registry is success. Possible values: true/false

cacheProducersPoolSize.description: This property specifies the max size of producer cache pool

csqDrainInOrder.description: This property is to enable/disable csqDrainInOrder

csqSize.description: This property specifies the csq size. Default value -1.

enabled.description: This property specifies the size of um_consumerIncludedStrings

jmsConnectionAliasId.description: A unique ID for the jmsConnectionAlias

jndi_automaticallyCreateUMAdminObjects.description: This property specifies whether to create UM admin objects automatically

jndi_connectionFactoryLookupName.description: This property specifies the connection factory lookup name for the JMS connection

jndi_connectionFactoryPollingInterval.description: This property specifies the connection factory polling interval

poolTimeout.description: This property specifies the poolTimeout value

producerCachingMode.description: This property is to enable/disable the producerCachingMode. 0 means disabled, 2 means Enable per destination

producerMaxRetryAttempts.description: This property specifies the max retry attempts value for the producer

producerRetryInterval.description: This property specifies the retry interval

producerSessionPoolMinSize.description: This property specifies the minimum size of producer session pool

producerSessionPoolSize.description: This property specifies the max size of producer session pool

transactionType.description: This property specifies the type of the transaction.Value 0 refers to NO-trans, 1 refers to Local-tran, 2 refers to XA-trans

um_loggingOutput.description: This property specifies the logging output value. 0 refers to server log, 1 refers to audit logging

um_producerIncludedStrings.description: This property specifies the size of um_producerIncludedStrings

um_producerMessageTracking.description: This property is to enable/disable the um_producerMessageTracking

user.description: This property specifies the user name to create the JMS connection

connFactoryName.description: This property specifies the connection factory name

executeACL.description: This property specifies the team name

jmsAliasType.description: This property specifies the jmsAliasType. Either it could be JMS or JNDI

jmsConnAlias.description: This property specifies the name of JMS connection

jndiProvAlias.description: This property specifies the name of JNDI

user.description: This property specifies the name of the user to create the JMS connection

includeConnFactoryName.description: This property enables/disables the includeConnFactoryName parameter

includeJNDIParams.description: This property enables/disables the includeJNDIParams parameter

jmsTriggerName.description: This property specifies the JMS Trigger name

replyToDestName.description: This property specifies the replyToDestName name

replyToDestType.description: This property specifies the replyToDestType type

timeToLive.description: This property specifies the timeToLive value

ignoreLocalPublished.description: This property specifies the status message of the JMS Trigger

isConcurrent.description: This property is to opt for the concurrent or serial execution of the JMS Trigger

jmsMessageSelector.description: This property specifies the message selector for the Queue or Topic

jmsTriggerId.description: A unique ID for the jmsTrigger

maxExecutionThreads.description: This property is to specify the maximum execution threads in case of concurrent execution

id.description: A unique ID for the strategy

claimsSet.description: key value pairs in the form of json map

clientPassword.description: Specify a base64 encoded password for the client principal

clientPrincipal.description: a unique identity to which Kerberos can assign tickets

requestDelegateToken.description: Boolean value whether the token needs to be delegated or not

servicePrincipal.description: a unique identifier of a service instance

servicePrincipalNameForm.description: the format in which you want to specify the principal name of the service that is registered with the principal database

kerberosConfigContents.description: The contents of the Kerberos configuration file conforming to the specification. If you do not want the default KDC and realm values from this configuration file to be overridden, then do not set values for the kerberosRealm and kerberosKDC properties. It contains the Kerberos configuration information, including the Kerberos realm, locations of KDCs, defaults for the current realm and for Kerberos applications, and the host names, Kerberos realms mappings and encryption algorithms. The full specification details of the Kerberos configuration file can be found in https://linux.die.net/man/5/krb5.conf.

kerberosConfigFileName.description: The name of the Kerberos configuration file to be stored and maintained in API Gateway.

kerberosKDC.description: The host name of the machine on which the Key Distribution Center (KDC) resides. If kerberosKDC is set, it overrrides the default KDC specified in the provided configuration file.

kerberosRealm.description: The domain name of the Kerberos server. If kerberosRealm is set, it overrides the realm specified in the provided configuration file.

useSubjectCreds.description: Indicates whether the Kerberos v5 Generic Security Services (GSS) mechanism should be used to obtain credentials from an existing subject.

bitarray.description: Comma separated list of bits (1/0) indicating whether the particular key alias has been successfully configured in API Gateway or not. For each key alias, 1 indicates that the key alias was loaded successfully and 0 indicates that the key alias was not loaded/configured.

fileContent.description: The contents of the keystore file.

isLoaded.description: Indicates whether the keystore is loaded or not. A keystore may not be loaded if there are errors while reading the keystore file or its key aliases.

isWarning.description: Indicates whether a warning is thrown by the API Gateway while persisting the keystore.

keyStoreName.description: The name of the keystore. It cannot contain spaces or special characters. The name of the key store must be unique across all the keystores created in API Gateway.

keyStorePassword.description: The keystore password that is defined at the time of keystore creation using a keystore utility.

keyStoreType.description: The certificate file format of the keystore.

message.description: The error or warning or success message from persisting the keystore in API Gateway. If there are failures in loading a keystore or a key alias, then the reasons for the failures are indicated by this message.

nullPKpasswds.description: Comma separated list of boolean values (false/true) indicating whether the particular alias has a password or not in the same order as the aliases specified in pkAliasesList. For each key alias, true indicates that the key alias does not have a password and false indicates that it does have a password.

pkAliasesList.description: Comma separated list of alias names in the uploaded keystore file.

pkPasswordsList.description: Comma separated list of passwords in the same order as the aliases specified in pkAliasesList. If a particular key alias does not have a password, it is denoted by space.

uploadFileName.description: The name of the keystore file that will be used to save the keystore internally in API Gateway.

KeystoreTruststore.description: This defines the keystore and truststore requred for the API Gateway.

cacheSize.description: The maximum number of LDAP users Integration Server can keep in memory in the user cache. The default is 10.

cacheTTL.description: The number of minutes an LDAP user's credentials (userid and password) can remain in the credential cache before being purged. The default is 60 minutes.

ldapDirectoryList.description: List of LDAP directories. This field is applicable when LDAP provider is chosen.

provider.description: Choose the authentication provider. Possible values are 'local' and 'LDAP'

Distinguished Name (DN) method.description: Specifies the DN method used for building the DN. Possible values are 'true' and 'false'.Select 'true' if the DN should be synthesized from the configured prefix and suffix values (Synthesize DN Method). These values are prefixed and suffixed to the username to build the DN. Select 'false' if the DN should be queried from a specified root directory (Query DN Method). The Synthesize DN method can be faster than the Query DN method because it does not perform a query against the LDAP directory. However, if your LDAP system does not contain all users in a single flat structure, use the Query DN method instead.

dnPrefix.description: A string that specifies the beginning of a DN you want to pass to the LDAP server. This field is applicable when 'useaf' is configured as 'true'. i.e, Synthesize DN Method is chosen.For example, if the prefix is 'cn=' and the suffix is ',ou=Users' and a user logs in specifying 'bob', API Gateway builds the DN 'cn=bob,ou=Users' and sends it to the LDAP server for authentication.

dnSuffix.description: A string that specifies the end of a DN you want to pass to the LDAP server. This field is applicable when 'useaf' is configured as 'true'. i.e, Synthesize DN Method is chosen.For example, if the prefix is 'cn=' and the suffix is ',ou=Users' and a user logs in specifying 'bob', API Gateway builds the DN 'cn=bob,ou=Users' and sends it to the LDAP server for authentication.

group.description: An API Gateway group with which the user is associated. The user is allowed to access services that members of this API Gateway group can access. This access is controlled by the teams with which the group is associated. If you also specify a value in the 'memberAttribute' field, the user has the same access as members of the API Gateway group and members of LDAP groups that have been mapped to an API Gateway team.

groupIdProperty.description: A property that identifies an LDAP group, such as CN. This field is required.

groupRootDN.description: The full distinguished name. For example, if you specify 'ou=groups,webMethods,dc=com', API Gateway will issue a query that will display all the LDAP groups. This field is required.

index.description: Index of the current LDAP directory. Priority of the LDAP directory among other directories is calculated using the index. The starting value of index for the LDAP directory with first priority is 0 and is incremented by 1 for subsequent LDAP directories.

memberAttribute.description: The name of the attribute in a group's directory entry that identifies each member of the group. This value is usually 'member' or 'uniqueMember', but can vary depending on the schema of the LDAP directory. API Gateway uses this information during team checking to see if the user attempting to log in belongs to an LDAP group that has been mapped to a team. If no value is specified here, API Gateway does not check for membership in an LDAP group. As a result, the user's access is controlled by the API Gateway group specified in the 'group' field.

password.description: The base 64 encoded password used by API Gateway to connect to the LDAP server.

poolMax.description: The maximum number of connections allowed in the pool that API Gateway maintains for connecting to the LDAP server. When API Gateway starts, the connection pool initially contains a minimum number of connections, which are specified in the Minimum Connection Pool field. API Gateway adds connections to the pool as needed until it reaches the maximum allowed. The default is 10.

poolMin.description: The minimum number of connections allowed in the pool that API Gateway maintains for connecting to the LDAP server. When API Gateway starts, the connection pool initially contains this minimum number of connections. API Gateway adds connections to the pool as needed until it reaches the maximum allowed, which is specified in the Maximum Connection Pool field. The default is 0.

principal.description: The user ID the Integration Server should supply to connect to the LDAP server, for example, o=webm.com or dc=webm,dc=com.  This user should not be the Administrator account, but a user that has permission to query groups and group membership. If your LDAP server allows anonymous access, leave this field blank.

timeout.description: The number of seconds the API Gateway will wait while trying to connect to the LDAP server. After this time has passed, the API Gateway will try the next configured LDAP server on the list. The default is 5 seconds.

uidProp.description: A property that identifies an LDAP userid, such as 'cn' or 'uid'.

url.description: The complete URL of the LDAP server. The URL has the format protocol://hostname:portnumber. Possible values of 'protocol' is 'ldap' for standard connections or 'ldaps' for secure connections. For example, ldaps://ldaphost1:700

userEmailAttribute.description: A property that identifies an LDAP user Email Address, such as 'mail' or 'email'.

userRootDn.description: Enter the full distinguished name. For example, configure this value as 'ou=users,dc=webMethods,dc=com', API Gateway will issue a query that starts searching in the root directory ou=users for a common name that matches the name the user logged in with.

name.description: The license name used for the API

url.description: A URL to the license used for the API

description.description: A description of the link

operationId.description: The name of an existing, resolvable OAS operation, as defined with a unique operationId. This field is mutually exclusive of the operationRef field

operationRef.description: A relative or absolute reference to an OAS operation. This field is mutually exclusive of the operationId field, and MUST point to an Operation Object. Relative operationRef values MAY be used to locate an existing Operation Object in the API definition

parameters.description: A map representing parameters to pass to an operation as specified with operationId or identified via operationRef. The key is the parameter name to be used, whereas the value can be a constant or an expression to be evaluated and passed to the linked operation. The parameter name can be qualified using the parameter location [{in}.]{name} for operations that use the same parameter name in different locations (e.g. path.id)

requestBody.description: A literal value or {expression} to use as a request body when calling the target operation

insecureTrustManager.description: Use insecure trust manager, to support self signed certificates

keyAlias.description: Key alias to be used for the GRPC Channel

keyStoreAlias.description: Key store alias to be used for the GRPC Channel

trustStoreAlias.description: Truststore alias to be used for the GRPC Channel

LoadBalancer.description: This defines the Load Balancer URLs configuration in the API Gateway.

httpUrls.description: HTTP URLs to be exposed for API invocation.

httpsUrls.description: HTTPS URLs to be exposed for API invocation.

websocketUrls.description: WebSocket URL to be exposed for Websocket APIs invocation.

certificateAlias.description: Select the certificate from the truststore that is used to validate the token.

description.description: Third party issuer description

trustStoreAlias.description: The truststore to be used by API Gateway when validating the token issued by the authorization server. Truststore is a repository that holds all the trusted public certificates

lockedAccounts.description: Comma separated list of user accounts which are locked.

LogConfiguration.description: This contains log settings of various components used by APIGateway.

apigatewayLogger.description: The log setting of APIGateway server.Possible values are off,trace,debug,info,warn,error and fatal

elasticSearchLogger.description: The log setting of Internal Data Store.Possible values are off,info,debug,warn,error and fatal

enableLogAggregation.description: Enabling log aggregation will collect logs from the different components and store in Internal Data Store or external Elasticsearch.The value can be true or false.

enableSecurityLogger.description: The log setting to enable APIGateway security logs.Possible values are true and false.

enableSessionLogger.description: The log setting enable APIGateway session logs.Possible values are off,trace,debug,info,warn,error and fatal

hostName.description: Hostname of external elastic search used to send the logs.

indexName.description: Indexname of external elastic search to store the accumulated logs.

kibanaLogger.description: The log setting of APIGateway dashboard.Possible values are silent,quiet and verbose

logDestination.description: Specifies where to store the accumulated logs from different stores. Value can be EXTERNAL_ES or INTERNAL

password.description: Password that is used to communicate the external elastic search.

port.description: Port to communicate the external elastic search.

protocol.description: Protocol to communicate the external elastic search.

sagOsgiLogger.description: The log setting of OSGI platform.Possible values are true and false.

userName.description: Username to communicate the external elastic search.

MasterPasswordExpiryInterval.description: The expiration interval is a recommended time between master password changes.The default expiration interval for a master password is 90 days.After the expiration date,API Gateway will continue to operate using the existing password indefinitely.

expireInterval.description: This interval(in days) specifies the time after which the master password would expire

MasterPasswordExpiryIntervalResponse.description: The schema of the response from the server when the expiry interval is updated

message.description: The response message from the server when the master password expiry interval is updated

result.description: This is the updated master password expiry interval(in days)

MasterPasswordProperties.description: Describes the master password configuration properties in API Gateway

daysTilExpire.description: The remaining number of days for the master password expiration

expireDate.description: The expiry date of the master password.The format for this field would be YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ssZ

expireInterval.description: The interval(in days) after which the master password would expire

expireMessage.description: The message which will be returned once the master password is expired

lastChangeDate.description: The latest date when the master password was updated.The format for this field would be YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ssZ

statusMessage.description: The current status of the master password

MasterPasswordResetResponse.description: Describes the response when the master password is reset

handleCount.description: The number of passwords that are updated during master password reset

message.description: The response message from the server when the master password is reset

MasterPasswordUpdate.description: Describes the properties required for updating the master password

newPassword.description: This is the base64 encoded value of the new master password

oldPassword.description: This is the base64 encoded value of the old master password

message.description: The response message from the server when the master password is updated

example.description: Example of the media type. The example object SHOULD be in the correct format as specified by the media type. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the example value SHALL override the example provided by the schema

examples.description: Examples of the media type. Each example object SHOULD match the media type and specified schema if present. The examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the examples value SHALL override the example provided by the schema

accessTokenURL.description: URL to get the access token from the authorization server

authorizeURL.description: URL to get the approval from the resource owner

refreshTokenURL.description: URL to get the new access token from the refresh token

allOf.description: This defines the aggregation structure to search across API Gateway

MigrationConfig.description: This model contains details about migration inputs in API Gateway

action.description: The type of migration action to be performed

indicesType.description: The type of indices to be reindexed for reindex action

properties.description: Migration properties for reindex action. Default values are taken from migration.properties file. Any value passed in here would overwrite the default value.

MobileApplicationConfiguration.description: Configured values are used in Threat protection Rules 'Mobile App filter'

mobileAppDeviceTypes.description: Configure Device Types to be filtered when Threat protection 'Mobile App Filter' Rule enforced

mobileApplications.description: Configure Mobile Application names to be filtered when Threat protection 'Mobile App Filter' Rule enforced

description.description: Endpoint description

default.description: The default value represents what would be assumed by the consumer of the input as the value of the schema if one is not provided. Unlike JSON Schema, the value MUST conform to the defined type for the Schema Object defined at the same level. For example, if type is string, then default can be "foo" but cannot be 1

endpoint.description: Client registration endpoint in the authorization server

keyAlias.description: The key alias is the private key that is used sign the request sent to the authorization server

keyStoreAlias.description: Specify the keystore that needs to be used by API Gateway while sending the request to the authorization server. A keystore is a repository of private key and its corresponding public certificate

authServerAlias.description: The name of the authorization server alias

id.description: A unique ID for the strategy

authServerAlias.description: The name of the authorization server alias

id.description: A unique ID for the strategy

authServerAlias.description: The name of the authorization server alias

id.description: A unique ID for the strategy

clientId.description: unique identifier of the oauth2 client

refreshCount.description: number of times an access token can be refreshed

scopes.description: the scopes associated with the client

serviceRegistryDisplayName.description: The name of the API in service registry when the API is published to a service registry.

authServerAlias.description: The name of the authorization server alias

id.description: A unique ID for the strategy

authServerAlias.description: The name of the authorization server alias

id.description: A unique ID for the strategy

callbacks.description: An optional, string description, intended to apply to all operations in this path

deprecated.description: Declares this operation to be deprecated. Consumers SHOULD refrain from usage of the declared operation. Default value is false

description.description: A verbose explanation of the operation behavior

mockedConditionsBasedCustomResponsesList.description: The list of mocked conditions and it's applicable only for mocked APIs

mockedResponses.description: The list of possible mocked responses as they are returned from executing this operation and it's applicable only for mocked APIs

operationId.description: Unique string used to identify the operation. The id MUST be unique among all operations described in the API. The operationId value is case-sensitive

parameters.description: A list of parameters that are applicable for this operation. If a parameter is already defined at the Path Item, the new definition will override it but can never remove it

responses.description: The list of possible responses as they are returned from executing this operation

summary.description: A short summary of what the operation does

tags.description: A list of tags for API documentation control. Tags can be used for logical grouping of operations by resources or any other qualifier

proxyServerList.description: Contains a map of the available outbound proxy server aliases in API Gateway with the key denoting the alias name and the value representing the corresponding outbound proxy server alias configuration.

entityId.description: The proxy server alias used to identify the entity in API Gateway.

ftpType.description: The type of the FTP proxy server. Applicable only if protocol value is FTP. Indicated by a number in the range 0 to 7. 0 - No proxy, 1 - ftp_user@ftp_host no proxy auth, 2 - ftp_user@ftp_host proxy auth, 3 - site command, 4 - open command, 5 - ftp_user@proxy_user@ftp_host, 6 - proxy_user@ftp_host, 7 - ftp_user@ftp_host proxy_user

host.description: The host name or IP address of the proxy server.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether this proxy server alias is the default for the corresponding protocol. There can be only one default proxy server alias for a given protocol. Y denotes Yes and N denotes No.

password.description: The password required to authenticate if authentication is enabled for the proxy server.

passwordHandle.description: The password handle which is used to store the password (if specified) in a secure manner in API Gateway.

port.description: The port number of the proxy server.

protocol.description: The protocol for which the proxy server is created.

proxyAlias.description: The outbound proxy server alias name. It must be unique across all outbound proxy server aliases defined in API Gateway. Once a proxy server alias is defined with a given name, it cannot be modified further.

socksVersion.description: The SOCKS version of the proxy server. Applicable only if protocol value is SOCKS. A value of 4 indicates SOCKS protocol version 4 and a value of 5 indicates SOCKS protocol version 5. SOCKS protocol version 4 does not support authentication and hence username/password cannot be specified if socksVersion = 4.

status.description: Indicates whether the particular proxy server alias is enabled or disabled.

username.description: The user name required to authenticate against if authentication is enabled for the proxy server.

apiIds.description: List of api ids needs to be associated to package. It can be either provided during the package creation or separately using package update call

creationDate.description: The creation date of package in milli seconds

customFields.description: This can be used to store additional information needed for a package

description.description: Description of the package

icon.description: An inline base64 encoded string representation of icon to be used in package

id.description: Id of the package. It will be autogenerated for the package on creation

modifiedDate.description: The modified date of package in milli seconds. This will be updated for package on update, hot edit, activate and deactivate.

planIds.description: List of plan ids needs to be associated to the package. It can be either provided during the package creation or separately using package update call

policyIds.description: Policy id that contains the IAM policy to use for APIs associated to package. It will be created automatically.

publishedPortals.description: List of published portal ids of the package.

tags.description: List of tags of the package. Either it can provided during the creation of the package or separately using the package update call

description.description: Description of action performed on package

id.description: Id of the package

status.description: Status of action performed on package

apis.description: List of api ids needs to be associated to package. It can be either provided during the package creation or separately using package update call

creationDate.description: The creation date of package in milli seconds

customFields.description: This can be used to store additional information needed for a package

description.description: Description of the package

icon.description: An inline base64 encoded string representation of icon to be used in package

id.description: Id of the package. It will be autogenerated for the package on creation

modifiedDate.description: The modified date of package in milli seconds. This will be updated for package on update, hot edit, activate and deactivate.

plans.description: List of plan ids needs to be associated to the package. It can be either provided during the package creation or separately using package update call

policyIds.description: Policy id that contains the IAM policy to use for APIs associated to package. It will be created automatically.

publishedPortals.description: List of published portal ids of the package.

tags.description: List of tags of the package. Either it can provided during the creation of the package or separately using the package update call

teams.description: List of details of associated teams of the package.

allowEmptyValue.description: Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters. This is valid only for query parameters and allows sending a parameter with an empty value

allowReserved.description: Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as defined by RFC3986 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding. This property only applies to parameters with an in value of query. The default value is false

content.description: A map containing the representations for the parameter. The key is the media type and the value describes it. The map MUST only contain one entry

deprecated.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use

examples.description: Examples of the media type. Each example SHOULD contain a value in the correct format as specified in the parameter encoding. The examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the examples value SHALL override the example provided by the schema

explode.description: When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value is false

extendedExample.description: Example of the media type. The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if present. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the example value SHALL override the example provided by the schema. To represent examples of media types that cannot naturally be represented in JSON or YAML, a string value can contain the example with escaping where necessary

get$ref.description: The available paths and operations for the API

in.description: The location of the parameter. Possible values are "query", "header", "path" or "cookie"

name.description: The name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive

required.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false

style.description: Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value. Default values (based on value of in): for query - form; for path - simple; for header - simple; for cookie - form

applicableUsers.description: List of users to whom the expiration interval setting is applicable. The users are separated by semicolon(;). For example, if you want to add user1 and user2 to the list, specify as 'user1;user2'

emailIds.description: List of email addresses to which API Gateway sends an email notification informing that the user password is about to expire or has already expired. The email addresses are separated by a new line character (\n). For example, 'u1@abc.com\nu2@abc.com'

expirationInterval.description: Number of days after which a password will expire, if not changed. The value should be a non-zero integer. Default value is 90.

expiryEmailBefore.description: Specifies the number of days prior to password expiry that API Gateway should start sending the reminder emails for password reset. The emails are sent daily until the user either updates the password or changes the expiration interval. Set the value to 0 to prevent API Gateway from sending the reminder emails for soon to expire passwords. Default value is 3.

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable the password expiry settings. Possible values are 'true' (enabled) and 'false' (disabled). Default value is 'false'

enablePasswordChange.description: Specifies whether users are allowed to change their passwords. These users must have developer privileges. Possible values are 'true' and 'false'. Default value is 'true'

historyLength.description: Maximum number of previously set passwords that API Gateway saves for a user (excluding the current password). You cannot choose a password that matches any of the stored passwords. Maximum value allowed for this field is 12. Default value is 0.

maxIdenticalCharsInARow.description:
Maximum number of identical characters
in a row a password can contain. Default value is 3

maxLength.description: Maximum number of characters (alphabetic characters, digits, and special characters combined) the password can contain. Default value is 64. Maximum value allowed for this field is 128

minDigits.description: Minimum number of digits the password must contain. Default value is 0

minLength.description: Minimum number of characters (alphabetic characters, digits, and special characters combined) the password must contain.Default value is 8

minLowerChars.description: Minimum number of lowercase alphabetic characters the password must contain. Default value is 0

minSpecialChars.description: Minimum number of special characters, such as asterisk (*), period (.), and question mark (?) the password must contain. Default value is 0

minUpperChars.description: Minimum number of uppercase alphabetic characters the password must contain. Default value is 0

mode.description: Specifies whether Administrator users are allowed to choose passwords that are not impacted by the password restriction settings. Possible values are 'strict' and 'lax'. Default value is 'lax'. For Administrator users, when this property is set to 'strict', API Gateway enforces the password restrictions. When set to 'lax', the password restrictions are not enforced. For non-administrators the restrictions are always enforced.

Terms.description: Terms of the plan usage as descriptive string

creationDate.description: The creation date of plan in milli seconds

customFields.description: This can be used to store additional information needed for a plan

description.description: Description of the plan

icon.description: An inline base64 encoded string representation of icon to be used in plan

id.description: Id of the plan. It will be autogenerated for the plan on creation

modifiedDate.description: The modified date of plan in milli seconds. This will be updated for plan on update.

policies.description: Policy that holds the rate limit throttling policy actions. It will created automatically. It can contain zero or more throttling policy action as rate limit policy

tags.description: List of tags of the plan

Policy.description: A policy is nothing but a group of policy (runtime) enforcements. It contains the list of policy enforcement ids by stage wise. A stage in a policy belongs execution order of a policy enforcement. Each policy enforcement belong to only one of the stage. For more details about policy stage please refer policyStages resource in API Gateway Policy Management service. The policy can be Service/scope/package/global/template.

descriptions.description: This contains list of description for the policy  with corresponding locale information.

id.description: Policy ID

names.description: This contains list of names for the policy with corresponding locale information.

parameters.description: This basic details of a threat protection rule such as rule name, description, rule action, custom error message etc.will be stored in this property.

policyEnforcements.description: This property contains list of policy (runtime) enforcement id grouped based on the stages.

policyScope.description: This property is used to refer the scope of the policy.

PolicyAction.description: This model contains details about a policy action in API Gateway

descriptions.description: List of policy action description with corresponding locale information

id.description: Policy Action ID

names.description: List of policy action names with corresponding locale information

parameters.description: This is the list of values that are configured for this policy actions

templateKey.description: Template key of the policy actions

PolicyActionOrder.description: PolicyActionOrder is used to specify the policy enforcement order in its respective stage

orderPosition.description:
Order of the policy enforcement. 
 1. First - policy enforcement needs to be added in its respective stage. 
 2. Last - policy enforcement needs to be added as last in its respective stage. 
 3. Before First occurrence - Policy needs to be added before the first occurrence of policyTemplateIds specified. 
 4. After last occurrence - Policy needs to be added after last occurrence of policyTemplateIds specified

policyTemplateIDs.description: List of policy template ids needed to process the order before first occurrence and after last occurrence

sequence.description:
Sequence of the policy enforcement.
 1. insequence - Stages or policies marked with this sequence will be executed when the request comes to API Gateway and before the request dispatched to native service. 
 2. outsequence - Stages or policies marked with this sequence will be executed when the request goes out of API Gateway to the invoker. 
 3. faultsequence - Stages or policies marked with this sequence will be executed when native service return any error

PolicyActionParameter.description: This model represent the values needed for a policy action to execute. This can be either primitive type or complex structure that in turn refer to another PolicyActionParameter

parameters.description: If this policy action parameter is complex type then array of policy action parameter will be the value for this parameter template key

values.description: array of values for this parameter template key

PolicyActionParameterTemplate.description: A policy action parameter template defines the schema for a policy enforcement parameter. A policy enforcement can have one or more policy action parameters.

applicableServiceTypes.description: List of Service type applicable for this policy action parameter

canRender.description: UI specific property. This property infer it can be rendered on UI

defaultValues.description: This contains the list of default values for this policy action parameter

isArray.description: This property infers whether this policy action parameter can be an array

isRequired.description: This property infers if it is added to a policy enforcement then it is mandate to provide value for this policy action parameter

templateKey.description: Unique id for policy action parameter

PolicyActionTemplate.description: A policy action template represents the schema for a policy enforcement.

applicableServiceTypes.description: Policy enforcement only applicable for the list of service type specified here

canAppliedAtResourceMethodLevel.description: This property infers that the policy action can be applied at resource/operation or method level.

dependentActions.description: Dependent list of policy enforcements. This policy enforcement can't be added with out the specified list of policy enforcement templates

mutuallyExclusiveActions.description: The list contains the mutually exclusive policy enforcements with this policy enforcement

names.description: Name of the policy enforcement along with the corresponding locale information

occurrence.description:
Allowed occurrence for the respective policy enforcement. 
 1. Once - Policy enforcement can be added only once on the respective stage. 
 2. Multiple - Policy enforcement can be added multiple times on the respective stage.

stageSpecific.description: Some policy enforcement can be added in multiple stages. This property specify it needs to be processed based on the stage it added.

templateKey.description: A unique id  for this policy enforcement

PolicyDetails.description: Details of the conflicting policies and policy enforcement of the respective policy

PolicyScope.description: Policy Scope of the conflicting policy.

policyActionsIds.description: List of IDs of conflicting policy enforcement of this policy

stageKey.description: Stage key of the conflicting policy enforcement of this policy

PolicyEnforcementStage.description: Each Policy Stage contains one or more policies. It provide you a the list of policy enforcement associated with each stage and its sequence either in, out or fault.

policyActionTempaltes.description: The list of policy enforcements can be applied on the respective stage.

sequence.description:
Sequence of the stage.
 1. insequence - Stages or policies marked with this sequence will be executed when the request comes to API Gateway and before the request dispatched to native service. 
 2. outsequence - Stages or policies marked with this sequence will be executed when the request goes out of API Gateway to the invoker. 
 3. faultsequence - Stages or policies marked with this sequence will be executed when native service return any error.

stageKey.description: The unique key for the stage.

PolicyEnforcements.description: This model contains the list of policy action id specific to a stage.

stageKey.description: Policy stage. User can refer resource /policyStages to get the list stages can be added here

description.description: Description of API Portal community.

id.description: ID of API Portal community.

status.description: Staus of the API Portal community.

PortalGateway.description: This defines the Portal Gateway configuration in the API Gateway.

gatewayPassword.description: API Gateway password for provided username used by API Portal to access API Gateway.

gatewayURL.description: Integration Server URL of the API Gateway.

gatewayUsername.description: API Gateway administrative privileged username used by API Portal to access API Gateway.

id.description: API Portal configuration object ID in API Gateway.

refId.description: Specifies API Gateway reference ID in API Portal. This is used to identify the API Gateway in API Portal.

stageName.description: Specifies the current stage name of the Gateway

PortalGatewayCommunitiesData.description: This defines the API Portal provider and communities information.

provider.description: The API Portal destination configuration name

PortalGatewayData.description: This defines the API Portal Gateway data in the API Gateway.

portalCommunities.description: List of API Portal communities to which APIs should be published.

PossibleValue.description: For policy action parameter we can define the list of possible values.

value.description: value that need to be used when providing value for the respective policy action parameter

ArchiveResult.description: List of the result of the promotion of all selected assets where key in the each element is the asset type

errorReason.description: Error reason for the promotion of assets, if the promotion is failed

status.description: Status of the promotion of assets

description.description: Description for the promotion

destinationStages.description: List of target stages (specified by stage ids) that you want to promote the assets

errorReason.description: Reason for the promotion if it's failed

includeApis.description: Include the APIs associated with the applications during the promotion of applications

includeApplications.description: Include the applications associated with the APIs during the promotion of APIs

includeSubscriptions.description: Include the subscriptions associated with the packages during the promotion of packages

owner.description: The user who initiates this promotion

promotedAssets.description: Map of assets with its associated asset ids to be promoted where key is the asset type and value is the list of asset ids. Possible asset types are "USER", "GROUP", "USERS", "GROUPS", "ACCESSPROFILES", "LDAPGROUPS", "CDSGROUPS", "ASSERTION", "APPLICATION", "API", "ALIAS", "POLICY", "POLICY_ACTION", "PLAN", "PACKAGE", "ADMINISTRATOR_SETTING", "PORTAL_GATEWAY", "OAUTH2_SCOPE_DATA", "SUBSCRIPTION", "API_DOCUMENT", "APPROVAL_CONFIGURATION", "OUTBOUND_PROXY", "URL_ALIAS", "KEYSTORE", "TRUSTSTORE", "KERBEROS_SETTING", "JNDI_PROVIDER_ALIAS", "JMS_CONNECTION_ALIAS", "JMS_TRIGGER", "WEB_SERVICE_ENDPOINT_ALIAS".

promotionResults.description: Result of the individual assets that is promoted to all destination stages along with the reason where key is the stage name

status.description: Overall status of the promotion whether it's success or failure

entityId.description: proxyBypass constance Fixed unique identifier value is proxyBypass

proxyBypassAddresses.description:
The host name or IP address of the server. In the Addresses field, type the fully qualified host and domain name of each server to which you want the Integration Server to issue requests directly. Type the host name and the domain name exactly as they appear in the URLs the server uses. To enter multiple names, separate each with commas.
You can use the asterisk (*) to identify several servers with similar names. The asterisk matches any number of characters. For example, if you want to bypass requests made to localhost, www.yahoo.com, home.microsoft.com, and all hosts whose names begin with NYC, you would type:
localhost,www.yahoo.com,home.microsoft.com, NYC*.*
